meanings.sent1: The children upreared a tower of blocks during playtime.
meanings.sent2: The workers upreared the new building in just a few months.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel upreared its tiny acorn house with great care.

meanings.sent5: The sunflowers upreared towards the sky, reaching for the sun.

meanings.definition: To raise or lift (something) to a vertical position
meanings.sent1: She upreared the flag proudly during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The weightlifter upreared the heavy barbell effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The magician upreared the rabbit out of the hat to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The giant upreared the massive boulder with ease.
meanings.sent5: The tree upreared its branches towards the sky after the storm.
